meanings.definition: One who makes something dirty or impure.
meanings.sent1: The befouler left a trail of mud and dirt wherever they went.
meanings.sent2: The befouler of the park was caught littering and polluting the environment.
meanings.sent3: The befouler of the classroom was the student who always left behind a mess.
meanings.sent4: The befouler of hearts, she broke them with her cruel words.
meanings.sent5: The befouler of innocence, the thief tainted the once pure town.

meanings.definition: To make something dirty or impure.
meanings.sent1: Please do not befouler the clean water by throwing trash in it.
meanings.sent2: The vandals tried to befouler the walls of the historic building with graffiti.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon managed to befouler the picnic area by scattering garbage around.
meanings.sent4: His lies had the power to befouler even the strongest friendships.
meanings.sent5: The factory's smokestacks befouler the air, causing pollution in the city.
